original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 900 - 42 = <<900-42=858>>858 feet of path to line.
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are poles every 6 feet, so the company needs 858 / 6 = <<858/6=143>>143 poles.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6538.
    Returns: the total number of fence poles placed along the path on both sides.
    """
    # L1
    total_path_length = 900 # a 900-foot path
    bridge_length = 42 # a 42-foot bridge
    path_to_line = total_path_length - bridge_length

    # L2
    pole_spacing = 6 # Every 6 feet, a fence pole is placed
    poles_one_side = path_to_line / pole_spacing

    # L3
    number_of_sides = 2 # on both sides
    total_fence_poles = poles_one_side * number_of_sides

    # FA
    answer = total_fence_poles
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {total_path_length} - {bridge_length} = <<{total_path_length}-{bridge_length}={path_to_line}>>{path_to_line} feet of path to line.
There are poles every {pole_spacing} feet, so the company needs {path_to_line} / {pole_spacing} = <<{path_to_line}/{pole_spacing}={poles_one_side}>>{poles_one_side} poles.

The poles have to go on both sides of the path, so there will be {poles_one_side} * {number_of_sides} = <<{poles_one_side}*{number_of_sides}={total_fence_poles}>>{total_fence_poles} fence poles along the whole path.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: There are poles every 6 feet, so the company needs 858 / 6 = <<858/6=143>>143 poles.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The poles have to go on both sides of the path, so there will be 143 * 6 = <<143*6=858>>858 fence poles along the whole path.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'pole_spacing' (6) was used instead of 'number_of_sides' (2).
